case.name: Deputy Commissioner of Taxation v Wellnora Pty Limited [2007] FCA 1542 (8 October 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: application by deputy commissioner of taxation (dct) to set aside deed of company arrangement (doca)
resolution passed at creditors' meeting in favour of execution of doca on casting vote of company administrator presiding at meeting
extent of obligations on that person in deciding how to cast vote
company was one of many in a group of companies, a large number of which had either gone into liquidation or executed a doca owing tax
dct was the only unsecured creditor, and voted against execution of doca
all creditors who voted in favour of doca were associated with company
whether person presiding at meeting of creditors must take into account the public interest and commercial morality when deciding how to exercise casting vote
whether doca had already terminated by reason of doca fund having been exhausted
whether order for "termination" of doca remained an available remedy.

legistitles.title: CORPORATIONS ACT 2001
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 445D When Court may terminate deed
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 445G When Court may void or validate deed
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 445H Effect of termination or avoidance
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 447A General power to make orders
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 600B Review by Court of resolution of creditors passed on casting vote of person presiding at meeting
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 600E Order under section 600A or 600B does not affect act already done pursuant to resolution
CORPORATIONS ACT 2001 - SECT 1321 Appeals from decisions of receivers, liquidators etc.
FEDERAL COURT RULES
